organization.fullName: Abramson Cancer Center at Penn Medicine

identificationModule.briefTitle: Understanding Quality of Life Among Patients With Cancer Receiving Palliative Care
identificationModule.officialTitle: Understanding Quality of Life Among Patients With Cancer Receiving Palliative Care

leadSponsor.name: Abramson Cancer Center at Penn Medicine

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This randomized controlled trial will assess the effects on quality of life of two approaches to symptom management among new patients referred to a palliative care oncology clinic.

armGroups.label: Intervention
armGroups.description: Participants in this group will consent to participate in a study about quality of life for patients with cancer seeking outpatient palliative care. They will be seen in a palliative care oncology clinic at which time they will be offered additional resources to promote symptom management. They will be asked to complete a series of surveys every two weeks for 16 weeks which will assess their quality of life, symptoms, and medication use.
interventionNames: Behavioral: Offering Additional Resources to Promote Symptom Management

armGroups.label: Usual Care
armGroups.description: Participants in this group will consent to participate in a study about quality of life for patients with cancer seeking outpatient palliative care. They will be seen in a palliative care oncology clinic where they will receive symptom management and supportive care. They will be asked to complete a series of surveys every two weeks for 16 weeks which will assess their quality of life, symptoms, and medication use.

interventions.name: Offering Additional Resources to Promote Symptom Management
interventions.description: Participants will be offered additional resources to promote symptom management.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Quality of Life - McGill Quality of Life Questionnaire
primaryOutcomes.description: Quality of life will be measured through the McGill Quality of Life Questionnaire Revised (MQOL-R). The questionnaire is 15 questions assessing overall and specific areas of quality of life.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Feasibility of Accessing Additional Resources for Symptom Management
secondaryOutcomes.description: Feasibility will be measured by whether participants accessed the additional resources for symptom management.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Acceptability of Accessing Additional Resources for Symptom Management
secondaryOutcomes.description: Acceptability will be measured by whether participants accessed the additional resources for symptom management.

Symptom severity will be measured through the Edmonton Symptom Assessment System (ESAS). The survey is 10 questions assessing the severity of pain, nausea, depression, etc. on a 0 to 10 scale-in which a 0 representing best possible state/symptom absence and a 10 representing worst possible state.
Medication use will be measured through a medication diary created for the study. The medication diary asks participants about recent medications, amounts, and dosages.
Hospital-free days will be measured through examination of participant's electronic health record.
Mortality will be measured through examination of participant's electronic health record.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Be a new patient at an outpatient palliative care clinic
* Resident of Pennsylvania
* Over 18 years of age

Exclusion Criteria:

* Prior use of certain symptom focused therapies
* Currently pregnant
